body.p: The Netlify connector facilitates the publishing of deliverable build outputs to the designated Netlify Site.

section.title: Requirements
section.p: To publish content to a Netlify Site, ensure you have the following:

ul.li: An existing Netlify Site configured. For more details, refer to the Netlify's Site Deploy topic.
A Personal Access Token associated with your Netlify account. For more details, refer to the Netlify's Personal Access Token topic.

section.p: For additional information regarding the above points, please consult the Netlify documentation

section.title: Define the Connector
section.p:
To configure a Netlify Connector, the following fields must be provided:
Connector Name The name of the connector.
Site ID The unique identifier associated with your Netlify Site.
Personal Access Token A security token used for authenticating your Netlify account.

section.title: Select the Netlify Connector in Deliverable Settings Page
section.p:
To publish the output of a deliverable to Netlify, please proceed with the following steps:
After configuring the Netlify Connector, navigate to the Deliverable Settings page. You can access this page by either editing an existing Deliverable or creating a new one.
Within the Deliverable settings page, check the "Upload output using a publishing connector" option checkbox.
Select the Netlify Connector that you previously defined from the provided list.
Save the Deliverable settings.
Begin the Deliverable build process. Upon completion, the build output will be published to the configured Netlify Site.
